title: Why did the captive Jews refuse to sing the Lord’s song in a foreign land? - Quora

response.answer_text: They refused to sing the Lord’s song in a foreign land as they were sad that they had been exiled to a foreign land from their Lord given land and they did not want to dishonour the LORD God by singing the Lord’s songs just because their new masters (The Babylonians) wanted them to sing and entertain them with the Lord’s song. Worship to God is holy and directed to the true God and not for cheap entertainment - Gospel music is for God not entertaining the world. So, here it is the Hebrews were very sad and sorrowful but also did not want dishonor the true God in a ‘strange land’ See this song by Boney M:
